q1.description:
Let's first guess what the following turing machine does.
Suppose w represents the input string and the current tape is #w#, answer the question on the right.
q1.question: Select one of the following statements that best describe this turing machine.
answer: A copy machine that transforms #w# into #w#w#.
choices: A shift machine that can shift a string to the LEFT of its original tape.
A copy machine that transforms #w# into #ww#.
A copy machine that transforms #w# into #w#w#.
A copy machine that transforms #w# into ww.

q3.question: Which machine is the initial machine of this copy machine.

q4.description: You are correct! Do you know what the <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> machine does?
q4.question: What does the <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> machine do?
answer: <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> means going to the closest empty cell on the left, from the head.
choices: <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> means going to one cell on the left, and then change the cell to #.
<font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> means going back to the previous machine of the turing machine.
<font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> means going to the closest empty cell on the left, from the head.

q5.description: Your classmate Alan says that the initial machine <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font> means we need to go to the closest space (denoted by #) on the left, from the head.
q5.question: Is that a true statement?

q6.description: Excellent! We start from the <font color='red'>$>L_{\#}$</font>. $L_{\#}$ means going to the closest space (denoted by #) on the left, from the head.
q6.question:
We will then move to the next machine $R$ by following the arrow direction.
What does the next machine $R$ mean?
answer: $R$ means moving from the current tape cell to the right tape cell.
choices: $R$ means moving from the current tape cell to the right tape cell.
$R$ means moving from the current tape cell to the next # cell on the right.

q7.description:
Well Done! $R$ means moving from the current tape cell to the right tape cell.
Now we can see that $R$ is followed by two arrows pointing to either right or down.
Answer the questions on the right to determine which arrow direction you should follow.
q7.question: Is the current tape cell a space or empty(i.e. #)? Then, which arrow direction should you follow? (Select all the correct answers.)
answer: No, it is not a space($\overline{\#}$).
choices: Yes, it is a space(#).
No, it is not a space($\overline{\#}$).

q8.description:
[Explanation to the questions on the previous slide.]
Is the current tape cell a space (i.e. #)?
No, the current tape cell is an 'a', so we follow the $\overline{\#}$ direction to go to the # machine.
q8.question:
Now, we are at the # machine.
What will the # machine do to the tape?
answer: erase the highlighted 'a' by making the tape cell empty (denoted by #).
choices: erase the highlighted 'a' by making the tape cell empty (denoted by #).
change the current position to the next empty cell (denoted by #) on the RIGHT.
change the current position to the next empty cell (denoted by #) on the LEFT.

q9.description:
Well Done! The # machine just replaced 'a' with '#'.
We are now at the $R^{2}_{\#}$ machine.
q9.question: What will the <font color='red'>$R^{2}_{\#}$</font> machine do to the tape?
answer: <font color='red'>$R^{2}_{\#}$</font>: change the current position to the second space(#) on the right.
choices: <font color='red'>$R^{2}_{\#}$</font>: change the current position to the second space(#) on the right.
<font color='red'>$R^{2}_{\#}$</font>: change the current position to the second cell on the right and then write '#' to the tape cell.
<font color='red'>$R^{2}_{\#}$</font>: change the current position to the next cell on the right and then write two '#' to the cell.
